content: In Tensorflow, when the function `tf.get_variable()` is called without specifying any initializer, what is the default method for variable initialization? The documentation only indicates 'None'.

In TensorFlow, when you use `tf.get_variable()` without explicitly specifying an initializer, it defaults to using a `glorot_uniform_initializer`, also known as Xavier initialization. This initializer is designed to keep the scale of the gradients roughly the same in all layers, which can help with the convergence of deep networks. However, it's always a good practice to specify an initializer explicitly to ensure clarity and avoid any unexpected behavior, especially if the default behavior changes in future versions.
